name: AI-Powered Google Maps Business Scraper with Enrichment & Export to Sheets

user.name: Msaid Mohamed el hadi
user.bio:
Hi! I‚Äôm Mohamed El Hadi, a passionate developer and automation expert from Algeria. I specialize in building smart, scalable workflows using n8n to streamline business operations, save time, and drive innovation.

üåç Open to collaborations | ü§ñ Automation lover | üíº Founder of EcoPetDZ & AADL Auto Reload

description:
### Overview

This workflow automates the discovery, extraction, enrichment, and storage of business information from **Google Maps** search queries using AI tools, scrapers, and Google Sheets.

It is ideal for:

* Lead generation agencies
* Local business researchers
* Digital marketing firms
* Automation & outreach specialists

---

### üîß Tools & APIs Used

* **Google Maps Search (via HTTP)**
* **Custom JavaScript Parsing**
* **URL Filtering & De-duplication**
* **Google Sheets (Read/Write)**
* **APIFY Actor** for business scraping
* **LangChain AI Agent** (OpenRouter - Gemini 2.5)
* **n8n Built-in Logic** (Loops, Conditions, Aggregators)

---

### üß† Workflow Summary

1. **Trigger**
   The automation starts via schedule (every hour).

2. **Read Queries from Google Sheet**
   Loads unprocessed keywords from a Google Sheet tab named `keywords`.

3. **Loop Through Keywords**
   Each keyword is used to search Google Maps for relevant businesses.

4. **Extract URLs**
   JavaScript parses HTML to find all external website URLs from the search results.

5. **Clean URLs**
   Filters out irrelevant domains (e.g., Google-owned, example.com, etc.), and removes duplicates.

6. **Loop Through URLs**
   For each URL:

   * Checks if it already exists in the Google Sheet (to prevent duplication).
   * Calls the **APIFY Actor** to extract full business data.
   * Optionally uses **AI Agent (Gemini)** to provide detailed insight on the business, including:

     * Services, About, Market Position, Weaknesses, AI suggestions, etc.
   * Converts the AI result (text) to a structured JSON object.

7. **Save to Google Sheet**
   Adds all extracted and AI-enriched business information to a separate tab (`Sheet1`).

8. **Mark Queries as Processed**
   Updates the original row in `keywords` to avoid reprocessing.

---

### üóÉÔ∏è Output Fields Saved

The following information is saved per business:

* Business Name, Website, Email, Phone
* Address, City, Postal Code, Country, Coordinates
* Category, Subcategory, Services
* About Us, Opening Hours, Social Media Links
* Legal Links (Privacy, Terms)
* Logo, Languages, Keywords
* **AI-Generated Description**
* Google Maps URL

---

### üìà Use Cases

* Build a **prospect database** for B2B cold outreach.
* Extract **local SEO insights** per business.
* Feed CRMs or analytics systems with **enriched business profiles**.
* Automate market research for **regional opportunity detection**.

---

### üì© Want a Similar Workflow?

If you‚Äôd like a custom AI-powered automation like this for your business or agency, feel free to contact me:

**üìß [msaidwolfltd@gmail.com](mailto:msaidwolfltd@gmail.com)**

data.details:
The IF node can be used to implement binary conditional logic in your workflow. You can set up one-to-many conditions to evaluate each item of data being inputted into the node. That data will either evaluate to TRUE or FALSE and route out of the node accordingly.

This node has multiple types of conditions: Bool, String, Number, and Date & Time.

data.details: The Execute Workflow node can be used when you want your workflow to treat another workflow as a step in your flow. It allows you to modularize your workflows and have a single source of truth for series of actions you perform often.

generic.label: How to get started with CRM automation (with 3 no-code workflow ideas
7 no-code workflow automations for Amazon Web Services

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.

The Filter node can be used to filter items based on a condition. If the condition is met, the item will be passed on to the next node. If the condition is not met, the item will be omitted. Conditions can be combined together by AND(meet all conditions), or OR(meet at least one condition).

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert business analyst.

Given a business website data, generate a JSON object with key business information and a detailed, insightful description that could be used to prepare for outreach or partnership discussions.

Focus the description on:

- What the business does (products/services)
- Their strengths or market position
- Technologies or platforms used (if identifiable)
- Unique value proposition
- Target customers
- Any possible gaps, pain points, or areas for improvement
- Why this business could benefit from external collaboration (e.g., automation, digital transformation, SEO, AI tools)

Format the output as a single JSON object with these fields:

- business_name
- website_url
- email
- phone_number
- address
- city
- postal_code
- country
- latitude
- longitude
- category
- subcategory
- opening_hours
- social_media_links (array)
- about_us
- services (array)
- contact_page_url
- privacy_policy_url
- terms_conditions_url
- logo_url
- languages (array)
- keywords (array)
- google_maps_url
- ai_description_detailed (a detailed paragraph or two with everything above)

Only output valid JSON.
if prompt is empty just return empty json data

parameters.query: SELECT * FROM input1 LEFT JOIN input2 ON 1=1

Focus the description on:

- Technologies or platforms used (if identifiable)
- Unique value proposition
- Target customers
- Any possible gaps, pain points, or areas for improvement
- Why this business could benefit from external collaboration (e.g., automation, digital transformation, SEO, AI tools)

Format the output as a single JSON object with these fields:

- business_name
- website_url
- email
- phone_number
- address
- city
- postal_code
- country
- latitude
- longitude
- category
- subcategory
- opening_hours
- social_media_links (array)
- about_us
- services (array)
- contact_page_url
- privacy_policy_url
- terms_conditions_url
- logo_url
- languages (array)
- keywords (array)
- google_maps_url
- ai_description_detailed (a detailed paragraph or two with everything above)

Only output valid JSON.",
  "screenshot": false,
  "startUrls": [
    {
      "url": "{{$json.url}}",
      "method": "GET"
    }
  ]
}
